instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820 2850, uefi problems
threads.message:
Hey, 

anyone have a bios with clean me and fixed checksum of the Fsys block? 

i need to change a serial number off this board. but this particulars boards not only changing the serial that solves the problem. anyone can help me? 

thanks

threads.title: 820 2850, uefi problems
threads.message:
Fsys checksum must be fixed after serial number is changed.
So upload your backup somewhere.

threads.message:

thanks

threads.title: 820 2850, uefi problems
threads.message: Kernel panics are going to be C9560...

threads.title: 820 2850, uefi problems
threads.message:
You didn't mention about kernel panics in first post.
Do NOT use hot air to replace C9560...

threads.title: 820 2850, uefi problems
threads.message:
guys i'm member of this group since 2016! i did repair many boards equals with C9560 problem! did not know was that it is not advisable to use hot air! 

1rst think i did on this board was replace C9560! 

Now, i know this board work perfectly with original BIOS! But with the bios that 2informaticos sent to me keeps freezing and shut down randomly. 

yesterday i was listening music with this mac all day with original bios and work's perfectly, no bugs! 

can you help me to build other bios? 

thanks

threads.title: 820 2850, uefi problems
threads.message:
Did you really upload backup of your board?
If I correctly remember, when I tried to clean ME region with Medusa, it reported no change, like ME was already clean; impossible for a booted BIOS.

threads.title: 820 2850, uefi problems
threads.message:
yes Mr.Vali! i'm sure. 

yesterday i also had the machine on all day and never failed with the bios i sent. 

today i read the bios again: 

[url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KTsCkxD9p3EfFCXpOlnoUfdevaR_PHAa/view?usp=sharing[/url]

S/N wanted: W8013T8GAGU

Can you try again with this bios please? 

thanks

threads.title: 820 2850, uefi problems
threads.message:
Sorry, was my mistake.
I use a 64Mb (W25Q64BV) chip soldered on Medusa adapter.
So the file read back was 8MB, instead of 4MB.
So, CUTT OFF last 4MB from the file I sent...

threads.title: 820 2850, uefi problems
threads.message: Can you build another one with serial i want ?? thanks

threads.title: 820 2850, uefi problems
threads.message: Did you try to flash only the first 4MB from the file already sent?

threads.title: 820 2850, uefi problems
threads.message:
sorry my mistake! bad understood last phrase! 

i have LBE and the program do this for me easy! i was spoke with the owner of program and he sad on next update he will add FSYS check sum in LBE.

i will test the machine with the bios and after that  will post the result!

thanks

threads.title: 820 2850, uefi problems
threads.message:
As far as I know, LBE does NOT clean ME; just replaces it with clean stock/generic ME region.
That is not the correct way!!!

threads.title: 820 2850, uefi problems
threads.message:
The previous BIOS is clean ME.
What bugs you have with it?
If you want to change serial number, just replace entire Fsys area with the one from your backup.

threads.title: 820 2850, uefi problems
threads.message:
I don't know how is it possible the previous bios to be clean! If i read from a working machine.. in this case the machine it's mine i bought from a client!

History:

1st the machine didn't show image. I Replace the graphic chip with one i had used and the mac start working well!

Whiling tested the machine i noticed that machine Freezes!

One time ago you help me to solve a problem like that.. The machine passed all ASD tests, memory frequency pc3-8500s, C7771 repaced etc.. And the problem was solved replacing again the Graphic chip.

On this mac i have now, i bought again another original chip from a trusted guy i usually buy but the machines keep going down 2-3 min after enter in operating system!

And in this case i notice the bios on this motherboard was touched!

I already Reballing 2 times this motherboard to be sure that chip was soldered well!

I need a working Bios before buying another graphic chip!

threads.title: 820 2850, uefi problems

I don't ignore anybody.
My Medusa tool is broken and din't recieve a new one yet.
I just sent your file to a friend and I wait to get it back soon.

You speak to soon and you have no idea about my problems...

threads.title: 820 2850, uefi problems
threads.message:
There is an issue with Medusa and 820-2850 BIOS.
My friend just replied me and he got the same error I reported in older post.
Medusa reports (no change) when try to clean ME region.
Is the same reason I said that uploaded file from the begining of the thread looks to have clean ME; even it was read from the board!

So I took my time and manually build a BIOS for you.
Test it and comment...
[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1T-1PVudbxsra73NQytq1-APvFyoLI7Vt[/url]

You always response in time in my posts and never failed me! i know you always help the people even yours problems. Please forget what i have said it's just a kid attitude!! I respect you very much Mr.Vali!
